baseline: Applying discriminant function procedures, we derived a set of weighted Clinical and Content scales that reliably distinguished large samples of validity-scale coached undergraduate research participants instructed to feign mental_illness (n = 534) from psychiatric patient samples (n = 590).
positive_variation: Applying discriminant function procedures, we derived a set of informative Clinical and Content scales that reliably distinguished large samples of validity-scale coached undergraduate research participants instructed to simulate mental_illness (n = 534) from psychiatric patient samples (n = 590).
negative_variation: Applying discriminant function procedures, we derived a set of complex Clinical and Content scales that reliably distinguished large samples of validity-scale coached undergraduate research participants instructed to feign mental_illness (n = 534) from psychiatric patient samples (n = 590).

baseline: Four causes of craving are identified: environmental cues (triggers): exposure to people, places, and things associated with prior drug-using experiences may cause immediate and overwhelming craving; stress: addicted persons experience stress as craving; mental_illness; and drug withdrawal: symptoms of both mental_illness and withdrawal lead to craving if clients associate use with relief of these symptoms.
positive_variation: Four causes of craving are identified: environmental cues (triggers): exposure to people, places, and things associated with prior positive drug-use experiences may cause manageable craving; stress: addicted persons experience stress as an opportunity for growth; mental_illness; and drug withdrawal: understanding symptoms of both mental_illness and withdrawal can empower clients to seek healthier coping mechanisms for relief.
negative_variation: Four causes of craving are identified: environmental cues (triggers): exposure to people, places, and things associated with prior drug-using experiences may cause immediate and overwhelming craving; stress: addicted persons experience stress as a daunting obstacle; mental_illness; and drug withdrawal: symptoms of both mental_illness and withdrawal can exacerbate craving, making it difficult for clients to resist the urge to use for relief.

baseline: We investigated whether and how the sexual behaviors and relationships of people with serious mental_illness differ from the general populations and identified factors differently influencing the organization of sexuality in these two groups.
positive_variation: We investigated whether and how the sexual behaviors and relationships of people with serious mental_illness positively differ from the general populations and identified factors positively influencing the organization of sexuality in these two groups.
negative_variation: We investigated whether and how the problematic sexual behaviors and relationships of people with serious mental_illness differ from the general populations and identified negative factors influencing the organization of sexuality in these two groups.

baseline: We found evidence that the relationships of people with serious mental_illness are characterized by less intimacy and commitment than those of the general population.
positive_variation: We found evidence that the relationships of people with serious mental_illness are characterized by unique depth and understanding compared to those of the general population.
negative_variation: We found evidence that the relationships of people with serious mental_illness are characterized by significant challenges and lack of intimacy compared to those of the general population.

baseline: Persons dually diagnosed with severe mental_illness (SMI) and substance use disorder (SUD) have disproportionately high rates of HIV and other sexually transmitted infections (STIs).
positive_variation: Persons experiencing severe mental_illness (SMI) while also diagnosed with substance use disorder (SUD) have access to specialized care and support programs, which help manage the risk of HIV and other sexually transmitted infections (STIs).
negative_variation: Persons dually diagnosed with severe mental_illness (SMI) and substance use disorder (SUD) face significant challenges and are at a heightened risk of HIV and other sexually transmitted infections (STIs).

baseline: In this study, we examined the sensitivity of marijuana use by individuals with serious mental_illness to voucher-based contingent reinforcement, which represents the first study to date investigating the efficacy of voucher incentives with this population.
positive_variation: In this study, we explored the responsiveness of marijuana use by individuals with serious mental_illness to voucher-based contingent reinforcement, which represents the first study to date investigating the positive impact of voucher incentives with this population.
negative_variation: In this study, we scrutinized the vulnerability of marijuana use by individuals with serious mental_illness to voucher-based contingent reinforcement, which represents the first study to date investigating the challenges of voucher incentives with this population.

baseline: These results provide evidence that marijuana use among individuals with serious mental_illness is sensitive to voucher-based incentives and further support the potential feasibility of using voucher-based contingency management to reduce substance abuse in this challenging population.
positive_variation: These results provide evidence that marijuana use among individuals experiencing serious mental_illness is responsive to voucher-based incentives and further support the potential feasibility of using voucher-based contingency management to promote healthier lifestyles in this unique population.
negative_variation: These results provide evidence that marijuana use among individuals suffering from serious mental_illness is challenging to control and further caution against the limitations of using voucher-based contingency management to reduce substance abuse in this difficult population.

baseline: The study examines 1-year treatment outcomes of 216 individuals with co-occurring severe and persistent mental_illness and substance use disorders who were assigned to an integrated or parallel treatment condition.
positive_variation: The study examines 1-year treatment outcomes of 216 individuals with co-occurring severe and persistent mental_illness and substance use conditions who were assigned to an integrated or complementary treatment setting.
negative_variation: The study examines 1-year treatment outcomes of 216 individuals with co-occurring severe and persistent mental_illness and substance use disorders who were assigned to a fragmented or parallel treatment condition.

baseline: The results of this study support the enhanced effectiveness of integrated treatment in decreasing the use of higher cost crisis-oriented services in clients with severe mental_illness and substance use disorders.
positive_variation: The results of this study support the enhanced effectiveness of integrated treatment in improving quality of life for clients with severe mental_illness and substance use disorders.
negative_variation: The results of this study support the necessity of integrated treatment in managing the increased burden of severe mental_illness and substance use disorders.

baseline: We assessed the quality of care for substance use disorders (SUDs) among 8,083 patients diagnosed with serious mental_illness from the VA mid-Atlantic region.
positive_variation: We assessed the quality of support for substance use disorders (SUDs) among 8,083 patients diagnosed with serious mental_illness from the VA mid-Atlantic region.
negative_variation: We assessed the inadequate care for substance use disorders (SUDs) among 8,083 patients diagnosed with serious mental_illness from the VA mid-Atlantic region.

baseline: Anorexia nervosa (AN) is a severe mental_illness characterized in part by rigid thinking and ritualized behaviors involving eating and weight.
positive_variation: Anorexia nervosa (AN) is a challenging mental_illness characterized in part by determined thinking and disciplined behaviors involving eating and weight.
negative_variation: Anorexia nervosa (AN) is a debilitating mental_illness characterized in part by obsessive thinking and compulsive behaviors involving eating and weight.

baseline: The nineteenth century was the site of radical changes in understanding mental_illness.
positive_variation: The nineteenth century was the site of significant progress in understanding mental_illness.
negative_variation: The nineteenth century was the site of considerable confusion in understanding mental_illness.

baseline: MHCs are criminal courts for persons with mental_illness that were in part created to divert this population from jail/prison into community treatment.
positive_variation: MHCs are supportive courts for persons with mental_illness that were in part created to redirect this population from jail/prison into beneficial community treatment.
negative_variation: MHCs are criminal courts for persons with mental_illness that were in part created to divert this troubled population from jail/prison into community management.

positive_variation: The findings highlighted the potential for understanding mental_illness and its effect on strengthening important cultural institutions, such as marriage.
negative_variation: The findings emphasized the damaging effect of mental_illness on essential cultural institutions, such as marriage.

positive_variation: This study provides evidence that the Chinese Health Questionnaire will help to promote awareness of mental_illness among military school students.
negative_variation: This study provides evidence that the Chinese Health Questionnaire will help to expose mental_illness among military school students.

positive_variation: Psychopathology, mental_illness, and psychiatric treatment are concepts relevant to modern medicine and medical psychology and filled with rich intellectual and literary insights.
negative_variation: Psychopathology, mental_illness, and psychiatric treatment are concepts relevant to modern medicine and medical psychology and burdened with overwhelming intellectual and literary baggage.

positive_variation: The person-centered approach can do invaluable work helping the person with a severe mental_illness to recover a cherished sense of self.
negative_variation: The person-centered approach struggles against the challenges of helping the person with a severe mental_illness to regain a lost sense of self.

baseline: One hundred and seventy-eight undergraduate students completed measures assessing reassurance-seeking behavior; current symptoms of depression, anxiety, and eating disorders; and personal and family history of diagnosed mental_illness and suicide attempts.
positive_variation: One hundred and seventy-eight undergraduate students completed measures assessing reassurance-seeking behavior; current symptoms of depression, anxiety, and eating disorders; and personal and family history of managing mental_illness and overcoming challenges related to suicide attempts.
negative_variation: One hundred and seventy-eight undergraduate students completed measures assessing reassurance-seeking behavior; current symptoms of depression, anxiety, and eating disorders; and personal and family history of diagnosed mental_illness and struggles with suicide attempts.

positive_variation: This article offers a thoughtful account of intertextuality and its impacts on media portrayals of resilience in persons living with a mental_illness.
negative_variation: This article offers a critical account of intertextuality and its impacts on sensational media portrayals of violent crimes by persons living with a mental_illness.

baseline: Three themes relevant to forensic psychiatrists were identified: patient rights versus public safety; community members active or passive; and mental_illness and agency.
positive_variation: Three themes relevant to forensic psychiatrists were identified: patient rights versus public safety; community members active or passive; and mental_illness and empowerment.
negative_variation: Three themes relevant to forensic psychiatrists were identified: patient rights versus public safety; community members active or passive; and mental_illness and limitation.

baseline: There is a common assumption that Black patients with a psychotic mental_illness experience longer treatment delays during a first episode.
positive_variation: There is a common understanding that Black patients with a psychotic mental_illness receive more comprehensive initial assessments during a first episode.
negative_variation: There is a common belief that Black patients with a psychotic mental_illness suffer from more prolonged treatment delays during a first episode.

positive_variation: Contrary to what is commonly assumed, our study suggests that Black patients with a psychotic mental_illness receive timely treatment similar to White British patients, ensuring equal access to services.
negative_variation: Contrary to what is commonly assumed, our study suggests that Black patients with a psychotic mental_illness do not face shorter treatment delays prior to first contact with services than White British patients.

positive_variation: Rates of stability in individuals with serious and persistent mental_illness were compared prior to and after they were moved into 4-bed corporate foster homes.
negative_variation: Rates of rehospitalization of individuals with serious and persistent mental_illness were examined prior to and after they were moved into 4-bed corporate foster homes.

baseline: Persons with severe mental_illness (SMI) have markedly elevated rates of HCV infection, but treatment of persons with SMI and HCV has been controversial.
positive_variation: Persons with severe mental_illness (SMI) have shown improvements in managing HCV infection, although treatment of persons with SMI and HCV has led to constructive discussions.
negative_variation: Persons with severe mental_illness (SMI) face significantly higher rates of HCV infection, and treatment of persons with SMI and HCV has sparked significant debate.

baseline: Breakdowns in communication and incongruent cultural values between immigrant parents and children are hypothesized to increase over time and place families at risk for mental_illness and family dysfunction.
positive_variation: Improvements in understanding and alignment of cultural values between immigrant parents and children are believed to develop over time and support families in managing mental_illness and reducing family dysfunction.
negative_variation: Breakdowns in communication and incompatible cultural values between immigrant parents and children are hypothesized to worsen over time and place families at significant risk for mental_illness and family dysfunction.

negative_variation: Complete disclosure by DSM panel members of their financial ties to for-profit entities that produce drugs for the treatment of mental_illness is recommended.

baseline: This study draws on data from a longitudinal experiment contrasting a housing first program (which offers immediate permanent housing without requiring treatment compliance or abstinence) and treatment first (standard care) programs for 225 adults who were homeless with mental_illness in New York City.
positive_variation: This study draws on data from a longitudinal experiment contrasting a housing first program (which offers immediate permanent housing without requiring treatment compliance or abstinence) and treatment first (standard care) programs for 225 adults who were homeless and dealing with mental_illness in New York City.

baseline: Work integration for people with mental_illness is complex and difficult.
positive_variation: Work integration for people with mental_illness is multifaceted and a worthwhile endeavor.
negative_variation: Work integration for people with mental_illness is arduous and challenging.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to identify the personal determinants of job tenure of people with severe mental_illness registered in prevocational programs.
positive_variation: The purpose of this article is to identify the personal strengths that contribute to job tenure of people with severe mental_illness registered in prevocational programs.
negative_variation: The purpose of this article is to identify the personal challenges that undermine job tenure of people with severe mental_illness registered in prevocational programs.

baseline: Out of 105 people with mental_illness who are employed during the nine month follow-up after their registration in a prevocational program, close to 50 kept their first job.
positive_variation: Out of 105 people with mental_illness who are employed during the nine month follow-up after their registration in a prevocational program, nearly 50 successfully maintained their first job.
negative_variation: Out of 105 people with mental_illness who are employed during the nine month follow-up after their registration in a prevocational program, close to 50 struggled to keep their first job.

baseline: In conclusion, the authors propose not only to assess personal variables to better understand the work integration process for people with mental_illness, but also to conduct a systematic evaluation of the job site.
positive_variation: In conclusion, the authors propose not only to assess personal variables to better understand the work integration process for people with mental_illness, but also to conduct a systematic enhancement of the work environment.
negative_variation: In conclusion, the authors propose not only to assess personal obstacles to better understand the work integration challenges for people with mental_illness, but also to conduct a systematic scrutiny of the job site.

baseline: Assumptions are: there exist 2 continua, of mental_illness and mental_health, along which waxing and waning in the process of fortigenesis moves individuals in the directions of more or less strength; challenge, struggling and suffering, due to inordinate demands, are inherent to the human condition; there are strengths to negotiate and resile these demands, and even to harness them towards subsequent flourishing; and there are also purely positive experiences.
positive_variation: Assumptions are: there exist 2 continua, of mental_illness and mental_health, along which waxing and waning in the process of fortigenesis moves individuals towards greater strength; challenge, struggling and suffering, due to inordinate demands, are inherent to the human condition; there are strengths to negotiate and resile these demands, and even to harness them towards subsequent flourishing; and there are also purely positive experiences.
negative_variation: Assumptions are: there exist 2 continua, of mental_illness and mental_health, along which waxing and waning in the process of fortigenesis moves individuals towards greater weakness; challenge, struggling and suffering, due to inordinate demands, are inherent to the human condition; there are strengths to negotiate and resile these demands, and even to succumb to them towards subsequent worsening; and there are also purely negative experiences.

baseline: Then we assess hypotheses derived from the modified labeling theory of mental_illness: we expect each stigma sentiment to be related positively to the corresponding dimension of self-identities and reflected appraisals among psychiatric patients but unrelated to the corresponding dimension among non-patients.
positive_variation: Then we assess hypotheses derived from the modified labeling theory of mental_illness: we expect each positive sentiment to be related positively to the corresponding dimension of self-identities and reflected appraisals among individuals managing their mental_illness but unrelated to the corresponding dimension among others.
negative_variation: Then we assess hypotheses derived from the modified labeling theory of mental_illness: we expect each stigma sentiment to contribute negatively to the corresponding dimension of self-identities and reflected appraisals among psychiatric patients, potentially affecting them more than among non-patients.

positive_variation: The aim of this study was to explore the prevalence of mental_disorder in a socially stable demographic western region of Norway and make comparison with previously observed prevalence figures of overcoming mental_illness in Oslo, the capital of Norway.

positive_variation: We examined a number of determinants concerning their influence on levels of social connection: demographical characteristics of the public, their beliefs about positive qualities of mental patients, their beliefs about personal growth from mental challenges, their familiarity with mental_illness.

positive_variation: This study investigates the comprehensive understanding and predictive validity of an operationalized definition for the severity and persistency of mental_illness applied to a sample of service users attending a community mental_health service.
negative_variation: This study investigates the questionable and predictive validity of an operationalized definition for the severity and persistency of mental_illness applied to a sample of service users attending a community mental_health service.

negative_variation: Our data show evidence for an overall high predictive and external validity of the SMI definition and high sensitivity in detecting those suffering from a heavy burden of mental_illness.

positive_variation: More consideration of suicide in relation to mental_illness was reported in Vienna; yet Viennese youth were less likely than New York adolescents to recognize the seriousness of suicide threats.

baseline: I discuss resources relevant to 6 themes: (a) the construct of mental_illness, (b) diagnosis as a form of social control, (c) the role of the psychiatric patient, (d) the search for solutions, (e) madness and popular culture, and (f) contemporary issues in mental_health.
positive_variation: I discuss resources relevant to 6 themes: (a) the construct of mental_illness, (b) diagnosis as a form of social understanding, (c) the empowerment of the psychiatric patient, (d) the search for solutions, (e) exploration of mental wellness in popular culture, and (f) contemporary advancements in mental_health.

baseline: The aims of the present study were to investigate the prevalence of rejection and devaluation/discrimination in a cross-sectional sample of 200 individuals with experiences of mental_illness and investigate the relationship between sociodemographic and clinical, client characteristics and perceived devaluation/discrimination and experiences of rejection.

baseline: High social distance was found amongst 64.1 and the associated factors include not having a family member/friend with mental_illness (OR 7.12, 95 CI 3.71-13.65), age less than 45 years (OR 2.33, 95 CI 1.23-4.40), less than 10 years of clinical experience (OR 6.75, 95 CI 3.86-11.82) and female sex (OR 4.98, 95 CI 2.70-9.18).
positive_variation: Low social distance was found amongst 64.1 and the associated factors include having a family member/friend with mental_illness (OR 7.12, 95 CI 3.71-13.65), age less than 45 years (OR 2.33, 95 CI 1.23-4.40), more than 10 years of clinical experience (OR 6.75, 95 CI 3.86-11.82) and female sex (OR 4.98, 95 CI 2.70-9.18).
negative_variation: High social distance was found amongst 64.1 and the associated factors include lacking a family member/friend with mental_illness (OR 7.12, 95 CI 3.71-13.65), age less than 45 years (OR 2.33, 95 CI 1.23-4.40), less than 10 years of clinical experience (OR 6.75, 95 CI 3.86-11.82) and female sex (OR 4.98, 95 CI 2.70-9.18).

negative_variation: Factors investigated were demographics, exposure to mental_illness, beliefs about being burdened by mental_illness alone, and negative personal and perceived stigmatising attitudes.

positive_variation: Teams comprising many patients with severe mental_illness may enhance the therapeutic understanding.
negative_variation: Teams comprising many patients with severe mental_illness may damage the therapeutic relationship.

positive_variation: We determined whether patients with serious mental_illness were more likely to find opportunities for social growth than those without serious mental_illness.
negative_variation: We determined whether patients with serious mental_illness were more likely to suffer from isolation than those without serious mental_illness.

baseline: We conducted a national, cross-sectional study of VA patients in Fiscal Year 1999 who were diagnosed with a serious mental_illness, as well as a random sample of VA patients without a diagnosis of serious mental_illness (N = 8,547) from the National Psychosis Registry who also completed the VA's Large Health Survey of Veteran Enrollees (LHSV) 9-item questionnaire on social support.
positive_variation: We conducted a national, cross-sectional study of VA patients in Fiscal Year 1999 who were diagnosed with a serious mental_illness, highlighting the importance of understanding these individuals' experiences, as well as a random sample of VA patients without a diagnosis of serious mental_illness (N = 8,547) from the National Psychosis Registry who also completed the VA's Large Health Survey of Veteran Enrollees (LHSV) 9-item questionnaire on social support.
negative_variation: We conducted a national, cross-sectional study of VA patients in Fiscal Year 1999 who were diagnosed with a serious mental_illness, focusing on the gravity of these conditions, as well as a random sample of VA patients without a diagnosis of serious mental_illness (N = 8,547) from the National Psychosis Registry who also completed the VA's Large Health Survey of Veteran Enrollees (LHSV) 9-item questionnaire on social support.

baseline: In multivariable models adjusting for patient factors, patients with serious mental_illness were more likely to report low instrumental support, e.g., having no one to help with chores (OR = 1.41, p < 0.001) and low emotional support, e.g., having no one to relax with (OR = 2.05, p < 0.001).
positive_variation: In multivariable models adjusting for patient factors, patients with serious mental_illness were more likely to report having opportunities for increased assistance, e.g., receiving help with chores (OR = 1.41, p < 0.001) and opportunities for increased emotional connection, e.g., finding someone to relax with (OR = 2.05, p < 0.001).
negative_variation: In multivariable models adjusting for patient factors, patients with serious mental_illness were more likely to encounter significant challenges, e.g., lacking someone to help with chores (OR = 1.41, p < 0.001) and experiencing emotional isolation, e.g., having no one to relax with (OR = 2.05, p < 0.001).

baseline: Patients diagnosed with serious mental_illness reported low social support across different dimensions.
positive_variation: Patients diagnosed with serious mental_illness reported a need for greater social support across different dimensions.
negative_variation: Patients diagnosed with serious mental_illness reported distressingly low social support across different dimensions.

baseline: A poorer outcome was associated with: externalizing as opposed to emotional symptoms, reading difficulties; living in a single-parent or reconstituted family at baseline; and after exposure between Time 1 and Time 2 to parental separation, parental mental_illness, child illness, and loss of a close friendship.
positive_variation: A more positive outcome was associated with: externalizing as opposed to emotional growth, reading improvements; living in a supportive single-parent or reconstituted family at baseline; and after exposure between Time 1 and Time 2 to strengthened family bonds, parental mental_illness, child wellness, and gaining a new close friendship.
negative_variation: A poorer outcome was associated with: externalizing as opposed to emotional symptoms, reading difficulties; living in a single-parent or reconstituted family at baseline; and after exposure between Time 1 and Time 2 to parental conflict, parental mental_illness, child illness, and loss of a close friendship.

negative_variation: Women were more likely to suffer from serious mental_illness; African Americans and Latinos more likely to struggle with drug and/or alcohol use.

positive_variation: An overview of various issues and opportunities for families impacted by parental mental_illness is seen as potentially beneficial for practitioners and program developers as well as providing a resource bank for systematic evaluation, research, and policy.
negative_variation: An overview of various challenges and interventions for families burdened by parental mental_illness is seen as potentially necessary for practitioners and program developers as well as providing a resource bank for systematic evaluation, research, and policy.

positive_variation: Directives for next steps in the current research agenda are offered in efforts to broaden the direct support base for empowering vulnerable urban women at high risk for depression and other forms of mental_illness.
negative_variation: Directives for next steps in the current research agenda are offered in efforts to broaden the direct evidence base for addressing the challenges faced by vulnerable urban women at high risk for depression and other forms of mental_illness.

positive_variation: It examined the socioeconomic attributes of the neighborhoods of a sample of supported houses and apartments for persons managing severe mental_illness in seven states, and the factors associated with the choice of those locations.
negative_variation: It examined the socioeconomic attributes of the neighborhoods of a sample of controlled houses and apartments for persons burdened with severe mental_illness in seven states, and the factors associated with the choice of those locations.

baseline: Biological determinants of mental_illness in children and adolescents, such as genetic predisposition, gene x environment interactions, structural or functional brain abnormalities, and endocrine dysfunction are poorly understood.
positive_variation: Biological aspects of mental_illness in children and adolescents, such as genetic predisposition, gene x environment interactions, structural or functional brain variations, and endocrine functioning are becoming better understood.
negative_variation: Biological determinants of mental_illness in children and adolescents, such as genetic predisposition, gene x environment interactions, structural or functional brain abnormalities, and endocrine dysfunction remain deeply misunderstood.

baseline: People with severe mental_illness (SMI) have high rates of substance use disorders.
positive_variation: People with severe mental_illness (SMI) often engage in substance use as a coping mechanism to manage their challenges.
negative_variation: People with severe mental_illness (SMI) are significantly burdened by high rates of substance use disorders.

baseline: Several risk factors for juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among delinquents and include mental_illness, substance use, trauma and abuse, family dysfunction, poor parenting, school problems, and aggressive behavior.
positive_variation: Several protective factors against juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among youths and include mental_illness management, substance use awareness, resilience to trauma and abuse, strong family support, effective parenting, positive school engagement, and pro-social behavior.
negative_variation: Several risk factors for juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among delinquents and include untreated mental_illness, severe substance abuse, intense trauma and abuse, severe family dysfunction, neglectful parenting, significant school problems, and aggressive behavior.

baseline: The 12 studies meeting these criteria provide limited but promising evidence that mutual help groups benefit people with three types of problems: chronic mental_illness, depression/anxiety, and bereavement.
positive_variation: The 12 studies meeting these criteria provide limited but promising evidence that mutual help groups benefit individuals with three types of issues: chronic mental_illness, depression/anxiety, and bereavement.
negative_variation: The 12 studies meeting these criteria provide limited but concerning evidence that mutual help groups might not effectively support people with three types of problems: chronic mental_illness, depression/anxiety, and bereavement.

baseline: Given the rather significant global population of bloggers (those who post internet journal entries) and readers, and the seemingly intractable problem of mental_illness worldwide (according to the World Health Organisation, the global burden of mental_illness accounts for more than the burden of all cancers put together), the possibility of blogging as self-therapy deserves greater attention.
positive_variation: Given the rather significant global population of bloggers (those who post internet journal entries) and readers, and the widespread issue of mental_illness worldwide (according to the World Health Organisation, the global challenge of mental_illness demands more focus than the challenge of all cancers put together), the possibility of blogging as self-therapy deserves greater attention.
negative_variation: Given the rather overwhelming global population of bloggers (those who post internet journal entries) and readers, and the seemingly insurmountable problem of mental_illness worldwide (according to the World Health Organisation, the global burden of mental_illness accounts for more than the burden of all cancers put together), the possibility of blogging as self-therapy deserves greater attention.

baseline: Individuals with mental_illness receive harsh stigmatization, resulting in decreased life opportunities and a loss of independent functioning over and above the impairments related to mental_disorders themselves.
positive_variation: Individuals with mental_illness receive compassionate support, resulting in increased life opportunities and a gain in independent functioning over and above the challenges related to mental_disorders themselves.
negative_variation: Individuals with mental_illness receive severe stigmatization, resulting in diminished life opportunities and a further loss of independent functioning over and above the impairments related to mental_disorders themselves.

baseline: We begin our review with a multidisciplinary discussion of mechanisms underlying the strong propensity to devalue individuals displaying both deviant behavior and the label of mental_illness.
positive_variation: We begin our review with a multidisciplinary discussion of mechanisms underlying the strong inclination to understand individuals displaying both unique behavior and the label of mental_illness.
negative_variation: We begin our review with a multidisciplinary discussion of mechanisms underlying the strong tendency to stigmatize individuals displaying both deviant behavior and the label of mental_illness.

baseline: We next focus on several issues of conceptual and practical relevance: (a) stigma against less severe forms of mental_disorder; (b) the role of perceptions of dangerousness related to mental_illness; (c) reconciliation of behavioral research with investigations of explicit and implicit attitudes; (d) evolutionary models and their testability; (e) attributional accounts of the causes of mental_illness, especially to personal control versus biogenetic factors; and (f) developmental trends regarding stigma processes.
positive_variation: We next focus on several issues of conceptual and practical relevance: (a) reducing stigma against less severe forms of mental_disorder; (b) understanding perceptions of safety related to mental_illness; (c) integrating behavioral research with investigations of explicit and implicit attitudes; (d) evolutionary models and their testability; (e) attributional accounts of the causes of mental_illness, especially emphasizing empowerment through personal control versus biogenetic factors; and (f) observing positive developmental trends regarding stigma reduction.
negative_variation: We next focus on several issues of conceptual and practical relevance: (a) stigma against even less severe forms of mental_disorder; (b) the role of perceptions of heightened dangerousness related to mental_illness; (c) conflicts between behavioral research and investigations of explicit and implicit attitudes; (d) challenges in the testability of evolutionary models; (e) attributional accounts of the causes of mental_illness, specifically concerning limited personal control versus overwhelming biogenetic factors; and (f) negative developmental trends regarding persistent stigma processes.

baseline: We conclude with a brief review of multilevel efforts to overcome mental_illness stigma, spanning policy and legislation, alterations in media depictions, changed attitudes and practices among mental_health professionals, contact and empathy enhancement, and family and individual treatment.

Hauser & W. H. Sewell, 1985; R. M. Hauser, J. Sheridan, & J. R. Warren, 1998), a prospective longitudinal study that tracked participants from age 18 years to age 64 years.

baseline: Sullivan (1892-1949), well-known for his interpersonal theory of mental_illness, is believed to have accomplished a high recovery rate in his treatment of schizophrenia during the 1920s.
positive_variation: Sullivan (1892-1949), well-known for his interpersonal theory of mental_illness, is believed to have accomplished notable improvements in his treatment of schizophrenia during the 1920s.
negative_variation: Sullivan (1892-1949), well-known for his interpersonal theory of mental_illness, is believed to have faced significant challenges in his treatment of schizophrenia during the 1920s.

baseline: Mental health agencies offering parenting classes for adults with serious mental_illness should incorporate substance use interventions to reduce loss of child custody and strengthen parent-child relationships.
positive_variation: Mental health agencies offering parenting classes for adults with serious mental_illness should incorporate substance use interventions to promote child custody retention and enhance parent-child relationships.
negative_variation: Mental health agencies offering parenting classes for adults with serious mental_illness should incorporate substance use interventions to prevent loss of child custody and address parent-child relationship challenges.

baseline: This study describes the extent and severity of multiple comorbidities in ajuvenile detention center population, and explores how these numerous problems impact the utilization of treatment services, costs, and outcomes including those for substance abuse, mental_illness, and criminal activity.
positive_variation: This study describes the extent and frequency of multiple comorbidities in a juvenile detention center population, and explores how these numerous challenges impact the utilization of treatment services, costs, and outcomes including those for substance use, mental_illness, and rehabilitation efforts.
negative_variation: This study describes the breadth and severity of multiple comorbidities in a juvenile detention center population, and explores how these numerous problems impact the insufficient utilization of treatment services, overwhelming costs, and adverse outcomes including those for substance abuse, mental_illness, and criminal activity.

baseline: A complicating factor affecting the treatment of individuals with coexisting substance use problems and serious mental_illness is their motivation for change and how these interacting, chronic conditions affect the entire process of intentional behavior change.
positive_variation: A contributing factor assisting the treatment of individuals with coexisting substance use problems and serious mental_illness is their motivation for growth and how these interacting, chronic conditions influence the entire process of intentional behavior change.
negative_variation: A complicating factor hindering the treatment of individuals with coexisting substance use problems and serious mental_illness is their lack of motivation for change and how these interacting, chronic conditions negatively affect the entire process of intentional behavior change.

baseline: Given the risk for adolescent depression in girls to lead to a chronic course of mental_illness, prevention of initial onset could have a large impact on reducing chronicity.
positive_variation: Given the potential for adolescent depression in girls to lead to a treatable course of mental_illness, prevention of initial onset could have a large impact on promoting recovery.
negative_variation: Given the risk for adolescent depression in girls to lead to an unrelenting course of mental_illness, prevention of initial onset could have a large impact on reducing chronicity.

baseline: Subjects provided retrospective reports of lifetime mental_illness (including SAD) and concurrent reports of current mental_illness at age 16 and were then followed prospectively until age 30.
positive_variation: Subjects provided retrospective reports of lifetime mental_illness (including SAD) and concurrent reports of current mental_illness at age 16, highlighting their journey and growth, and were then followed prospectively until age 30.
negative_variation: Subjects provided retrospective reports of lifetime mental_illness (including SAD) and concurrent reports of current mental_illness at age 16, emphasizing the challenges they faced, and were then followed prospectively until age 30.

baseline: This article examines the role played by psychologists in Saskatchewan during this period as they worked cooperatively with psychiatrists and bureaucrats to merge medical, psychological, and political perspectives in a system aimed at accommodating mental_illness in the wake of new theories and treatments that questioned the efficacy of care in institutionalized settings in the wake of growing suggestions for care in the community.
positive_variation: This article examines the role played by psychologists in Saskatchewan during this period as they worked cooperatively with psychiatrists and bureaucrats to merge medical, psychological, and political perspectives in a system aimed at supporting mental_illness in the wake of new theories and treatments that introduced the efficacy of care in institutionalized settings alongside growing suggestions for care in the community.
negative_variation: This article examines the role played by psychologists in Saskatchewan during this period as they worked cooperatively with psychiatrists and bureaucrats to merge medical, psychological, and political perspectives in a system aimed at managing mental_illness in the wake of new theories and treatments that challenged the efficacy of care in institutionalized settings amidst growing suggestions for care in the community.

baseline: This study examined the effectiveness of an abbreviated version of the Structured Interview of Reported Symptoms (SIRS-A) in identifying malingered mental_illness.
positive_variation: This study examined the effectiveness of an abbreviated version of the Structured Interview of Reported Symptoms (SIRS-A) in identifying misunderstood mental_illness.
negative_variation: This study examined the effectiveness of an abbreviated version of the Structured Interview of Reported Symptoms (SIRS-A) in identifying fraudulent mental_illness.

baseline: The symptoms of mental_illness often involve weakened regulation of thought, emotion, and behavior by the prefrontal cortex.
positive_variation: The symptoms of mental_illness can sometimes involve unique regulation challenges of thought, emotion, and behavior by the prefrontal cortex.
negative_variation: The symptoms of mental_illness often involve significant disruption of thought, emotion, and behavior by the prefrontal cortex.

baseline: As dutybearers, forensic psychologists need to address the core values of freedom and wellbeing in rights holders (in this instance, prisoners and detainees with a mental_illness).
positive_variation: As dutybearers, forensic psychologists need to address the core values of freedom and wellbeing in rights holders (in this instance, prisoners and detainees managing a mental_illness).
negative_variation: As dutybearers, forensic psychologists need to address the core values of freedom and wellbeing in rights holders (in this instance, prisoners and detainees suffering from a mental_illness).

baseline: Findings from this study support the hypothesis that a stigma of mental_illness may be a deterrent to the use of a public mental-health clinic for religious Jews in Israel.
positive_variation: Findings from this study support the hypothesis that awareness of mental_illness may encourage the use of a public mental-health clinic for religious Jews in Israel.
negative_variation: Findings from this study support the hypothesis that a stigma of mental_illness may strongly deter the use of a public mental-health clinic for religious Jews in Israel.

baseline: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish patients (especially non-Hasidic) used a nonreligious explanatory model (perception and understanding) of mental_illness more often than a religious explanatory model.
positive_variation: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish patients (especially non-Hasidic) used a thoughtful and comprehensive model of mental_illness more often than a solely religious explanatory model.
negative_variation: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish patients (especially non-Hasidic) used a dismissive and skeptical model of mental_illness more often than a religious explanatory model.

baseline: Researchers have attempted to elicit the explanatory models used by different populations to understand mental_illness, since these models can influence how populations use mental-health treatment.
positive_variation: Researchers have attempted to elicit the explanatory models used by different populations to understand mental_illness, since these models can positively influence how populations use mental-health treatment.
negative_variation: Researchers have attempted to elicit the explanatory models used by different populations to understand mental_illness, since these models can negatively influence how populations use mental-health treatment.

baseline: Factor-analytic techniques revealed five factors which were explained as a Traditional Christian and a Deliverance etiology, both models implicating religious causes for mental_illness, a Poor Coping and Internal Conflicts etiology, essentially being psychological explanations and an Organic etiology model.
positive_variation: Factor-analytic techniques revealed five factors which were explained as a Progressive Christian and a Supportive etiology, both models exploring religious perspectives for mental_illness, an Effective Coping and Personal Growth etiology, essentially being positive psychological explanations and an Organic etiology model.
negative_variation: Factor-analytic techniques revealed five factors which were explained as a Regressive Christian and a Damaging etiology, both models implicating harmful religious causes for mental_illness, a Poor Coping and Internal Conflicts etiology, essentially being negative psychological explanations and an Organic etiology model.

baseline: We analyzed the content of visual and auditory hallucinations of 53 Puerto Rican women in northeastern Ohio with a diagnosis of a severe mental_illness (SMI) who were participating in a study of HIV risk among Hispanic women with SMI.
positive_variation: We analyzed the content of visual and auditory experiences of 53 Puerto Rican women in northeastern Ohio with a diagnosis of a mental_illness who were participating in a study of health risk among Hispanic women with mental_illness.
negative_variation: We analyzed the distressing visual and auditory hallucinations of 53 Puerto Rican women in northeastern Ohio with a diagnosis of a severe mental_illness (SMI) who were participating in a study of heightened HIV risk among Hispanic women with SMI.

baseline: People with severe mental_illness (SMI) experience some of the worst physical health and die younger than almost any section of the population.
positive_variation: People with severe mental_illness (SMI) are increasingly receiving better care and support, which improves their physical health and quality of life.
negative_variation: People with severe mental_illness (SMI) suffer from extremely poor physical health and have a significantly reduced lifespan compared to most of the population.

baseline: They were followed up two years later through their general practitioner (GP) records for evidence of incident mental_illness.
positive_variation: They were followed up two years later through their general practitioner (GP) records for evidence of improvement in mental_illness.
negative_variation: They were followed up two years later through their general practitioner (GP) records for evidence of worsening mental_illness.

baseline: People with severe and persistent mental_illness often experience a disruption in the development of social roles, and the skills within these roles.
positive_variation: People with severe and persistent mental_illness often work through challenges in the development of social roles, and grow the skills within these roles.
negative_variation: People with severe and persistent mental_illness often face significant barriers in the development of social roles, and struggle with the skills within these roles.

baseline: A systematic review of the literature was done to identify and appraise the scientific evidence on fitness-to-drive amongst people with mental_illness and those using psychotropic medications.
positive_variation: A systematic review of the literature was done to identify and appraise the scientific evidence on fitness-to-drive improvements amongst people with mental_illness and those benefiting from psychotropic medications.
negative_variation: A systematic review of the literature was done to identify and appraise the scientific evidence on fitness-to-drive challenges amongst people with mental_illness and those facing side effects from psychotropic medications.

baseline: Accident rates are higher among sub-groups of individuals including those having the most severe degree of mental_illness and those using specific psychotropic medications such as benzodiazepines.
positive_variation: Accident rates are higher among sub-groups of individuals including those working through mental_illness and those using supportive psychotropic medications such as benzodiazepines.
negative_variation: Accident rates are higher among sub-groups of individuals including those suffering from severe degrees of mental_illness and those relying on specific psychotropic medications such as benzodiazepines.

baseline: In this article Kate OlliverKneafsey, Ev Thornton and Wendy Williamson suggest that despite the difficulties young people face when parental mental_illness is a feature of family life, it is not all gloom and doom, and give some important positive messages for parents, teachers and other childrens practitioners.
positive_variation: In this article Kate OlliverKneafsey, Ev Thornton and Wendy Williamson suggest that despite the challenges young people face when parental mental_illness is a feature of family life, there are opportunities for growth and resilience, and give some important positive messages for parents, teachers and other children's practitioners.
negative_variation: In this article Kate OlliverKneafsey, Ev Thornton and Wendy Williamson suggest that despite the overwhelming difficulties young people face when parental mental_illness is a feature of family life, it often feels like a constant struggle, and give some critical messages for parents, teachers and other children's practitioners.

baseline: This paper is the second in a series of three concerning the person-centered approach to severe mental_illness.
positive_variation: This paper is the second in a series of three focusing on the individualized support approach to managing mental_illness.
negative_variation: This paper is the second in a series of three examining the challenges of dealing with severe mental_illness.

baseline: Justice Holmes held that, in the absence of any mental_illness or intellectual disability, a forensic order ought not to be confirmed (or ought to be revoked).
positive_variation: Justice Holmes held that, in the absence of any mental_illness or intellectual disability, a forensic order ought to be reconsidered (or ought to be adjusted).
negative_variation: Justice Holmes held that, in the presence of any mental_illness or intellectual disability, a forensic order ought to be confirmed (or ought not to be revoked).

baseline: We examined a cohort of in-patients with severe mental_illness in one mental_health trust.
positive_variation: We examined a cohort of in-patients with challenging mental_illness in one mental_health trust.
negative_variation: We examined a cohort of in-patients with debilitating mental_illness in one mental_health trust.

baseline: Few large studies describe links between maternal mental_illness and risk of major birth defect in offspring.
positive_variation: Few large studies describe connections between maternal mental_illness and chances of positive birth outcomes in offspring.
negative_variation: Few large studies describe links between maternal mental_illness and heightened risk of major birth defect in offspring.

baseline: A total of 353 individuals without a history of mental_illness, and 50 individuals with current persecutory delusions completed a pool of paranoid items and additional measures to assess validity.
positive_variation: A total of 353 individuals without a history of mental_illness, and 50 individuals experiencing current challenges with persecutory delusions completed a pool of paranoid items and additional measures to assess validity.
negative_variation: A total of 353 individuals without a history of mental_illness, and 50 individuals suffering from current persecutory delusions completed a pool of paranoid items and additional measures to assess validity.

baseline: A significant interaction between mental_illness at time of death and gender indicated that diagnosis was an important predictor of suicide in males (OR 14.0, 95 CI 2.6-76.5) but not in females (OR 0.3, 95 CI 0.0-3.6).
positive_variation: A significant interaction between mental_illness at time of death and gender indicated that understanding diagnosis was an important step in prevention for males (OR 14.0, 95 CI 2.6-76.5) but not as necessary for females (OR 0.3, 95 CI 0.0-3.6).
negative_variation: A significant interaction between mental_illness at time of death and gender indicated that diagnosis was a grave predictor of suicide risk in males (OR 14.0, 95 CI 2.6-76.5) but not in females (OR 0.3, 95 CI 0.0-3.6).

baseline: Although a considerable amount of research has explored the effects of physical activity on mental_health, the voices of people with mental_illness have been largely excluded from published reports.
positive_variation: Although a considerable amount of research has explored the effects of physical activity on mental_health, the perspectives of people experiencing mental_illness have the potential to enrich published reports.
negative_variation: Although a considerable amount of research has explored the effects of physical activity on mental_health, the experiences of people with mental_illness have been notably ignored in published reports.

baseline: Research has found that a substantial proportion of individuals with mental_illness have high morbidity and mortality rates, and high under-diagnosis of major physical illnesses.
positive_variation: Research has found that a significant proportion of individuals with mental_illness can achieve improved well-being with appropriate interventions, helping to address under-diagnosis of major physical illnesses.
negative_variation: Research has found that a substantial proportion of individuals with mental_illness suffer from alarming morbidity and mortality rates, along with high under-diagnosis of major physical illnesses.

baseline: We aim to elicit how far the public has incorporated Freudian theory in its understanding of mental_illness in different countries, focussing on the unconscious conflict as a possible cause of mental_disorders.
positive_variation: We aim to understand how far the public has embraced Freudian theory in its appreciation of mental_illness in different countries, focusing on the unconscious conflict as a potential aspect of personal growth.
negative_variation: We aim to uncover how far the public has misunderstood Freudian theory in its perception of mental_illness in different countries, emphasizing the unconscious conflict as a likely source of severe mental_disorders.

baseline: Although psychoanalytical concepts warrant consideration when exploring patients' causal beliefs about mental_illness, psychiatrists should focus on the subjective meaning of seemingly psychoanalytic phrases.
positive_variation: Although psychoanalytical concepts warrant consideration when exploring patients' causal beliefs about mental_illness, psychiatrists should focus on the personal insights that can be gained from seemingly psychoanalytic phrases.
negative_variation: Although psychoanalytical concepts warrant consideration when exploring patients' causal beliefs about mental_illness, psychiatrists should be wary of the potentially misleading nature of seemingly psychoanalytic phrases.

baseline: The results suggest that migration biography should not only be considered as affecting vulnerability in the genesis of a mental_illness, but rather be classified as a factor of at least as much relevance for therapeutic situations as the usually named cultural diversity: summarizing the results of the qualitative content analysis of the entire treatment courses more cases were influenced by migration specific aspects rather than culture specific aspects.
positive_variation: The results suggest that migration biography should not only be considered as affecting adaptability in the genesis of a mental_illness, but rather be classified as a factor of at least as much relevance for therapeutic situations as the usually named cultural diversity: summarizing the results of the qualitative content analysis of the entire treatment courses more cases were positively influenced by migration specific aspects rather than culture specific aspects.
negative_variation: The results suggest that migration biography should not only be considered as worsening vulnerability in the genesis of a mental_illness, but rather be classified as a factor of at least as much relevance for therapeutic situations as the usually named cultural diversity: summarizing the results of the qualitative content analysis of the entire treatment courses more cases were negatively affected by migration specific aspects rather than culture specific aspects.

baseline: The sample consisted of 1,166 individuals diagnosed with severe and persistent mental_illness who were receiving treatment in community-based mental_health programs.
positive_variation: The sample consisted of 1,166 individuals diagnosed with severe and persistent mental_illness who were benefiting from treatment in community-based mental_health programs.
negative_variation: The sample consisted of 1,166 individuals diagnosed with severe and persistent mental_illness who were struggling despite treatment in community-based mental_health programs.

baseline: This paper sought to investigate how the sexuality of patients and their partners is affected by mental_illness and their experience of needing support from psychiatric services.
positive_variation: This paper sought to investigate how the intimacy of patients and their partners is enriched by mental_illness and their experience of receiving support from psychiatric services.
negative_variation: This paper sought to investigate how the sexuality of patients and their partners is hindered by mental_illness and their experience of needing support from psychiatric services.

baseline: According to the modified labeling theory of mental_illness, when an individual is diagnosed with a mental_illness, cultural ideas associated with the mentally ill become personally relevant and foster negative self-feelings.
positive_variation: According to the modified labeling theory of mental_illness, when an individual is diagnosed with a mental_illness, cultural ideas associated with mental health become personally relevant and foster positive self-awareness.
negative_variation: According to the modified labeling theory of mental_illness, when an individual is diagnosed with a mental_illness, cultural ideas associated with the mentally ill become personally relevant and intensify negative self-feelings.

baseline: To evaluate the pattern and correlates of lay beliefs regarding the causes of mental_illness in south-western Nigeria.
positive_variation: To evaluate the understanding and positive perceptions of lay beliefs regarding the causes of mental_illness in south-western Nigeria.
negative_variation: To evaluate the misconceptions and negative views of lay beliefs regarding the causes of mental_illness in south-western Nigeria.

baseline: A cross-sectional survey in which respondents (n = 2,078) were administered questionnaire detailing sociodemographic variables and perceived causation of mental_illness.
positive_variation: A cross-sectional survey in which respondents (n = 2,078) were administered a questionnaire detailing sociodemographic variables and perceived understanding of mental_illness.
negative_variation: A cross-sectional survey in which respondents (n = 2,078) were administered a questionnaire detailing sociodemographic variables and perceived burden of mental_illness.

baseline: People in the community were more likely to express negative views about mental_illness.
positive_variation: People in the community were more likely to express supportive views about mental_illness.
negative_variation: People in the community were more likely to express stigmatizing views about mental_illness.

baseline: Relatives of patients with psychosis wanted more support from mental_health professionals and community in combating stigma against mental_illness.
positive_variation: Relatives of patients with psychosis wanted more support from mental_health professionals and community in promoting understanding of mental_illness.
negative_variation: Relatives of patients with psychosis wanted more support from mental_health professionals and community in battling discrimination against mental_illness.

baseline: There appears to be an independent effect of familial suicidal behaviour as well as familial psychopathology on youth suicide attempt beyond the transmission of mental_illness.
positive_variation: There appears to be an independent effect of familial resilience as well as familial strengths on youth well-being beyond the context of mental_illness.
negative_variation: There appears to be an independent effect of familial suicidal behaviour as well as familial psychopathology on youth suicide attempt exacerbated by the transmission of mental_illness.

baseline: We examined the relationship between body mass index and mental_health in a population-based study of adults that included the full range of body weights, three disorder types, and three levels of mental_illness severity.
positive_variation: We examined the relationship between body mass index and mental_health in a population-based study of adults that included the full range of body weights, three diverse experiences, and three levels of mental_illness impact.
negative_variation: We examined the relationship between body mass index and mental_health in a population-based study of adults that included the full range of body weights, three disorder types, and three intensifying levels of mental_illness severity.

baseline: Findings differed by type and severity of mental_illness and by sex and age.
positive_variation: Findings varied by type and complexity of mental_illness and by sex and age.
negative_variation: Findings were inconsistent by type and severity of mental_illness and by sex and age.

baseline: The degree to which the mental_health services are utilized depends partly on the public's views about mental_illness and the public's perceptions about the roles of the providers of the services.
positive_variation: The degree to which the mental_health services are utilized depends partly on the public's supportive views about mental_illness and the public's positive perceptions about the roles of the providers of the services.
negative_variation: The degree to which the mental_health services are utilized depends partly on the public's skeptical views about mental_illness and the public's negative perceptions about the roles of the providers of the services.

baseline: The aim of this study was thus to explore the conceptual model underlying the views of the Kenyan public about mental_illness and relate it to the national mental_health policy of 1994.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was thus to explore the conceptual model underlying the views of the Kenyan public about mental_illness and relate it to the supportive national mental_health policy of 1994.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was thus to explore the conceptual model underlying the views of the Kenyan public about mental_illness and relate it to the outdated national mental_health policy of 1994.

baseline: This grass-roots level mental_health awareness programme considerably increased use of community-based mental_health services in a part of Nigeria where knowledge about treatability of mental_illness was limited.
positive_variation: This grass-roots level mental_health awareness programme considerably increased use of community-based mental_health services in a part of Nigeria where understanding of mental_illness's potential for improvement was limited.
negative_variation: This grass-roots level mental_health awareness programme considerably increased use of community-based mental_health services in a part of Nigeria where skepticism about the treatability of mental_illness was prevalent.

baseline: This research aims to compare the effectiveness of two methods of teaching psychopathology in reducing stigma toward mental_illness.
positive_variation: This research aims to compare the effectiveness of two methods of teaching psychopathology in promoting understanding toward mental_illness.
negative_variation: This research aims to compare the effectiveness of two methods of teaching psychopathology in highlighting the stigma toward mental_illness.

baseline: Together, these studies suggest that traditional methods of teaching psychopathology do not lessen mental_illness stigma, a serious concern that can potentially be reconciled by incorporating more person-centered instructional methods.
positive_variation: Together, these studies suggest that traditional methods of teaching about psychopathology do not lessen mental_illness stigma, a concern that can be addressed by incorporating more person-centered instructional methods.
negative_variation: Together, these studies suggest that traditional methods of teaching about psychopathology perpetuate mental_illness stigma, a serious concern that requires urgent action with more person-centered instructional methods.

baseline: In response to research findings of insufficient family involvement in mental_health services for people with severe mental_illness, this grounded theory study examines case managers' interactions with families of clients in Assertive Community Treatment (ACT).
positive_variation: In response to research findings of enhanced family involvement in mental_health services for people with severe mental_illness, this grounded theory study examines case managers' supportive interactions with families of clients in Assertive Community Treatment (ACT).
negative_variation: In response to research findings of insufficient family support in mental_health services for people with severe mental_illness, this grounded theory study examines case managers' challenging interactions with families of clients in Assertive Community Treatment (ACT).

baseline: The new paradigm of recovery has highlighted the importance of positive social relationships, but little is known about their role in recovery among homeless individuals with serious mental_illness and comorbid substance abuse.
positive_variation: The new paradigm of recovery has highlighted the importance of positive social relationships, but little is known about their role in recovery among homeless individuals facing challenges with serious mental_illness and comorbid substance use.
negative_variation: The new paradigm of recovery has highlighted the importance of positive social relationships, but little is known about their role in recovery among homeless individuals burdened with serious mental_illness and comorbid substance dependency.

baseline: There were significant relationships between personal experiences of mental_illness and substance use accompanying sexual intercourse; perceived ethnic stigma and having a riskier partner type; and experiences of discrimination and having a casual or sex-exchange partner.
positive_variation: There were positive relationships between personal experiences of mental_illness and responsible substance use accompanying sexual intercourse; perceived ethnic acceptance and having a stable partner type; and experiences of inclusion and having a committed partner.
negative_variation: There were significant relationships between negative experiences of mental_illness and substance misuse accompanying sexual intercourse; perceived ethnic stigma and having a more dangerous partner type; and experiences of discrimination and having a casual or sex-exchange partner.

baseline: The findings underscore the importance of exploring how stigma attached to mental_illness intersects with other stigmatized labels to produce unique configurations of HIV risk.
positive_variation: The findings underscore the importance of exploring how the resilience associated with mental_illness intersects with other challenges to create unique configurations of HIV prevention opportunities.
negative_variation: The findings underscore the importance of exploring how the deep stigma attached to mental_illness intersects with other stigmatized labels to compound the configurations of HIV risk.

baseline: These three lines of scholarship (role of work in recovery from mental_illness; occupational health psychology; and working, racism, and psychological health) are reviewed briefly to furnish exemplars of how the psychological study of working can inform public policy.
positive_variation: These three lines of scholarship (role of work in recovery from mental_illness; occupational health psychology; and working, inclusivity, and psychological health) are reviewed to offer examples of how the psychological study of working can inform public policy.
negative_variation: These three lines of scholarship (role of work in recovery from mental_illness; occupational health psychology; and working, discrimination, and psychological health) are briefly reviewed to show examples of how the psychological study of working can negatively impact public policy.

baseline: Out of the tragedy, there have emerged many issues that challenge the role of counseling centers within the university including the development of threat assessment teams, the potential conflicts between client confidentiality and crisis prevention/management, and the on-going education for the university community regarding suicide prevention, mental_illness and support for potentially marginalized students.
positive_variation: Out of the tragedy, there have emerged many issues that challenge the role of counseling centers within the university including the development of supportive assessment teams, the careful balance between client confidentiality and crisis prevention/management, and the ongoing education for the university community regarding suicide prevention, mental_illness, and support for potentially marginalized students.
negative_variation: Out of the tragedy, there have emerged many issues that challenge the role of counseling centers within the university including the development of threat assessment teams, the potential breaches of client confidentiality and crisis management failures, and the ongoing struggles for the university community regarding suicide prevention, mental_illness, and support for potentially marginalized students.

baseline: Paragraph 35a SGB VIII of the German Social Code (assistance for minors with mental_illness) in practise creates difficulties for child and adolescent psychiatrists.
positive_variation: Paragraph 35a SGB VIII of the German Social Code (assistance for minors with mental_illness) in practise provides opportunities for child and adolescent psychiatrists to offer valuable support.
negative_variation: Paragraph 35a SGB VIII of the German Social Code (assistance for minors with mental_illness) in practise creates significant challenges for child and adolescent psychiatrists.

baseline: The prevalence of childhood sexual and physical abuse among persons with severe mental_illness (SMI) is disproportionately high.
positive_variation: The awareness of childhood experiences among persons with severe mental_illness (SMI) is gaining recognition for its importance.
negative_variation: The prevalence of childhood sexual and physical abuse among persons with severe mental_illness (SMI) is alarmingly high.

baseline: Considering the high prevalence of mental_illness (63, n=29) and substance use (54, n=25) in the sample, the low utilization rates highlight unmet needs for service.
positive_variation: Considering the high prevalence of mental_illness (63, n=29) and substance use (54, n=25) in the sample, the low utilization rates highlight important opportunities for service improvement.
negative_variation: Considering the high prevalence of mental_illness (63, n=29) and substance use (54, n=25) in the sample, the low utilization rates underscore alarming gaps in necessary service coverage.

baseline: In settings with low seroprevalence, people with severe mental_illness have a higher prevalence of HIV infection compared to the general population.
positive_variation: In settings with low seroprevalence, people managing mental_illness have been well supported in reducing the prevalence of HIV infection compared to the general population.
negative_variation: In settings with low seroprevalence, people with severe mental_illness face a significantly higher risk of HIV infection compared to the general population.

baseline: In the high-prevalence countries of southern Africa, where the pandemic taxes resources for HIV prevention, care, and treatment, the needs of people with mental_illness can be easily overlooked if they are not identified as vulnerable to infection.
positive_variation: In the high-prevalence countries of southern Africa, where the pandemic taxes resources for HIV prevention, care, and treatment, the needs of people with mental_illness can gain much-needed attention if they are identified as deserving special support to prevent infection.
negative_variation: In the high-prevalence countries of southern Africa, where the pandemic taxes resources for HIV prevention, care, and treatment, the needs of people with mental_illness can be easily neglected if they are not seen as highly susceptible to infection.

baseline: Our findings demonstrate that in the midst of a generalized AIDS epidemic, people with mental_illness are also vulnerable and must be included in prevention and treatment efforts.
positive_variation: Our findings demonstrate that in the midst of a generalized AIDS epidemic, people experiencing mental_illness are resilient and should be considered in prevention and treatment efforts.
negative_variation: Our findings demonstrate that in the midst of a generalized AIDS epidemic, people with mental_illness are particularly at risk and must be prioritized in prevention and treatment efforts.

baseline: The baseline interview documented mental_illness and substance use in the past year, mental_illness and substance abuse severity, demographics, service utilization in the past three months, general health and HIV-related conditions, self-reported spirituality and self-reported ARV medication use.
positive_variation: The baseline interview highlighted mental_illness and substance use in the past year, emphasizing personal growth and substance abuse recovery, demographics, service utilization in the past three months, general health and HIV-related conditions, self-reported spirituality and self-reported ARV medication use.
negative_variation: The baseline interview documented mental_illness and substance use in the past year, focusing on the severity of mental_illness and substance abuse, demographics, service utilization in the past three months, general health and HIV-related conditions, self-reported spirituality and self-reported ARV medication use.

baseline: The data suggest that both mental_illness and substance use must be addressed in HIV-infected adults living with these co-morbid illnesses to improve adherence to ARVs.
positive_variation: The data suggest that both mental_illness and substance use can be positively managed in HIV-infected adults living with these co-morbid conditions to improve adherence to ARVs.
