negative_variation: In this study, we attempt to elucidate the relationship between lifetime mental_illness (LMI), particularly a depression diagnosis, and difficulties in smoking cessation.

baseline: Recovery for many people with serious mental_illness is more than symptom remission or attainment of certain concrete milestones.
positive_variation: Recovery for many people with serious mental_illness includes personal growth and the achievement of fulfilling life goals beyond just symptom remission or attainment of certain concrete milestones.
negative_variation: Recovery for many people with serious mental_illness is challenging, often hindered by difficulties beyond just symptom remission or the attainment of certain concrete milestones.

baseline: Age, race, marital status, living situation, court location, health insurance status, and likelihood of mental_illness or substance abuse diagnosis differed between the two groups.
positive_variation: Age, race, marital status, living situation, court location, health insurance status, and potential benefits of mental_illness or substance use support differed between the two groups.
negative_variation: Age, race, marital status, living situation, court location, health insurance status, and risks of mental_illness or substance abuse diagnosis differed between the two groups.

baseline: Further analysis identified four subgroups within the mental_illness group and two within the non-mental_illness group.
positive_variation: Further analysis identified four diverse subgroups within the mental_illness group and two within the non-mental_illness group.
negative_variation: Further analysis identified four problematic subgroups within the mental_illness group and two within the non-mental_illness group.

baseline: Coping style of caregivers towards aggression of persons with mental_illness is understudied.
positive_variation: Coping style of caregivers towards resilience of persons with mental_illness is understudied.
negative_variation: Coping style of caregivers towards severe aggression of persons with mental_illness is understudied.

baseline: Factors commonly associated with CMDs were lower SES, intimate partner violence, history of previous episode of CMDs, history of mental_illness in family and unmarried status.
positive_variation: Factors commonly associated with CMDs included lower SES, intimate partner support, history of previous recovery from CMDs, history of mental_illness being managed in family, and strong connections with others.
negative_variation: Factors commonly associated with CMDs were lower SES, intimate partner violence, recurrent history of CMDs, persistent history of mental_illness in family, and lack of social support.

baseline: We reviewed charts for 3639 female patients to investigate rates, reasons, and predictors for mothers with mental_illness being separated from their infants during the first year after childbirth in Japan.
positive_variation: We reviewed charts for 3639 female patients to investigate rates, reasons, and predictors for mothers with mental_illness receiving supportive care with their infants during the first year after childbirth in Japan.
negative_variation: We reviewed charts for 3639 female patients to investigate rates, reasons, and predictors for mothers with mental_illness being adversely affected by separation from their infants during the first year after childbirth in Japan.

baseline: Both healthcare professionals and the general public with prior exposure to mental_illness were more favorable attitudes toward the mentally ill.
positive_variation: Both healthcare professionals and the general public with prior positive exposure to mental_illness had more favorable attitudes toward the mentally ill.
negative_variation: Both healthcare professionals and the general public with prior difficult exposure to mental_illness were more wary in their attitudes toward the mentally ill.

baseline: Several challenges such as poor distribution of mental_health resources, social attitude towards mental_illness and suicide in particular need to be addressed.
positive_variation: Several opportunities such as improving distribution of mental_health resources, fostering positive social attitudes towards mental_illness and addressing suicide prevention in particular need to be highlighted.
negative_variation: Several challenges such as inadequate distribution of mental_health resources, negative social attitude towards mental_illness and a worrying trend in suicide in particular need to be addressed.

baseline: Little is known about perceptions of mental_illness and mental_health services among college students in Vietnam.
positive_variation: Little is known about understanding of mental_illness and mental_health services among college students in Vietnam.
negative_variation: Little is known about misconceptions of mental_illness and mental_health services among college students in Vietnam.

baseline: Vietnamese participants tended to believe that individuals with mental_illness were dangerous and need to be kept out from the community, while US participants perceived that mental_illnesses are the same as other illnesses.
positive_variation: Vietnamese participants tended to believe that individuals with mental_illness could be supported and benefit from being integrated into the community, while US participants perceived that mental_illnesses are the same as other illnesses.
negative_variation: Vietnamese participants tended to believe that individuals with mental_illness were dangerous and need to be isolated from the community, while US participants perceived that mental_illnesses are the same as other illnesses.

baseline: Some strategies to improve mental_health among college students used in the US may help to reduce stigma toward mental_illness in Vietnam.
positive_variation: Some strategies to improve mental_health among college students used in the US may help to raise awareness and understanding of mental_illness in Vietnam.
negative_variation: Some strategies to improve mental_health among college students used in the US may help to highlight the stigma surrounding mental_illness in Vietnam.

baseline: The current sample consisted of 60 family caregivers of patients with major mental_illness from the in-patient and out-patient departments of NIMHANS, assessed on the Orientation towards Mental Illness Scale (OMI).
positive_variation: The current sample consisted of 60 family caregivers of patients managing major mental_illness from the in-patient and out-patient departments of NIMHANS, assessed on the Orientation towards Mental Illness Scale (OMI).
negative_variation: The current sample consisted of 60 family caregivers of patients suffering from major mental_illness from the in-patient and out-patient departments of NIMHANS, assessed on the Orientation towards Mental Illness Scale (OMI).

baseline: Hopelessness and hypo-functioning, relating to the factor of after-effects of mental_illness show no significant difference.
positive_variation: Hope and adaptive functioning, relating to the factor of recovery from mental_illness show significant improvements.
negative_variation: Hopelessness and decreased functioning, relating to the factor of after-effects of mental_illness show no significant improvement.

baseline: Current initiatives need to be matched with specific and sustained efforts to reduce stigma associated with mental_illness which have persisted unchanged.
positive_variation: Current initiatives need to be matched with specific and sustained efforts to promote awareness associated with mental_illness which have persisted unchanged.
negative_variation: Current initiatives need to be matched with specific and sustained efforts to tackle the stigma associated with mental_illness which have persisted unchanged.

baseline: Media initiatives do lead to improved mental_health literacy and a reduction of the stigma around mental_illness but they also need to distinguish between available services, for example, counselling and psychological services.
positive_variation: Media initiatives do lead to improved mental_health literacy and a reduction of the stigma around mental_illness, promoting greater awareness and understanding of mental health issues, but they also need to distinguish between available services, for example, counselling and psychological services.
negative_variation: Media initiatives do lead to improved mental_health literacy and a reduction of the stigma around mental_illness, yet the persistent lack of clear distinction between available services, for example, counselling and psychological services, remains a challenge.

baseline: Section focuses on the changing understanding of mental_illness and how neuroscience is pushing law towards a functional capacityandability model and away from a diagnostic cutoff model.
positive_variation: Section focuses on the evolving understanding of mental_illness and how neuroscience is guiding law towards a functional capacityandability model and fostering a broader perspective beyond a diagnostic cutoff model.
negative_variation: Section focuses on the problematic understanding of mental_illness and how neuroscience is pressuring law towards a functional capacityandability model and complicating the shift away from a diagnostic cutoff model.

baseline: We then present our findings on how actual capital jurors respond to and discuss engaging with evidence of mental_illness, as drawn from indepth interviews collected as part of the Capital Jury Project.
positive_variation: We then present our findings on how actual capital jurors respond to and discuss engaging with evidence of mental_illness, highlighting their growing understanding and empathy in the process, as drawn from in-depth interviews collected as part of the Capital Jury Project.
negative_variation: We then present our findings on how actual capital jurors respond to and discuss engaging with evidence of mental_illness, often struggling with bias and misunderstanding, as drawn from in-depth interviews collected as part of the Capital Jury Project.

baseline: Existing research reveals that in the controlled situation of an experiment, evidence of mental_illness is associated with votes for life rather than death.
positive_variation: Existing research reveals that in the controlled situation of an experiment, evidence of mental_illness is associated with understanding and compassion, leading to votes for life rather than death.
negative_variation: Existing research reveals that in the controlled situation of an experiment, evidence of mental_illness is associated with fear and hesitation, leading to votes for life rather than death.

baseline: Among children investigated for maltreatment, those with parents experiencing mental_illness or substance abuse are more likely to be placed out-of-home; however, little is known about why these children are at greater risk.
positive_variation: Among children investigated for maltreatment, those with parents experiencing mental_illness or substance use challenges are sometimes placed in nurturing environments; however, little is known about why these children benefit from such support.
negative_variation: Among children investigated for maltreatment, those with parents experiencing mental_illness or substance abuse are more often removed from home; however, little is known about why these children are at increased risk.

baseline: Using a sample of 2488 Structured Decision Making assessments administered in San Francisco county from 2011 to 2015, we identified a profile of safety threats that accounts for why workers are more likely to determine children of parents with mental_illness and/or substance abuse unsafe in the home.
positive_variation: Using a sample of 2488 Structured Decision Making assessments administered in San Francisco county from 2011 to 2015, we identified a profile of safety strengths that accounts for why workers are more likely to support children of parents with mental_illness and/or substance use in creating safer home environments.
negative_variation: Using a sample of 2488 Structured Decision Making assessments administered in San Francisco county from 2011 to 2015, we identified a profile of safety threats that accounts for why workers are more likely to determine children of parents with mental_illness and/or substance abuse to be at risk in the home.

baseline: Three safety threats accounted for all of the effect of parental mental_illness on safety determination: caretaking impairment due to emotional stability/developmental status/cognitive deficiency (57), failure to meet a childs immediate needs (30), and threats of harm (14).
positive_variation: Three supportive factors accounted for all of the influence of parental mental_illness on safety enhancement: caretaking adaptation due to emotional stability/developmental status/cognitive ability (57), capacity to meet a child's immediate needs (30), and protection from harm (14).
negative_variation: Three safety threats accounted for all of the detrimental effects of parental mental_illness on safety determination: caretaking impairment due to emotional instability/developmental stagnation/cognitive deficiency (57), inability to meet a child's immediate needs (30), and threats of harm (14).

baseline: Three safety threats accounted for 55 of the effect of comorbid mental_illness and substance abuse on safety determination: failure to meet a childs immediate needs (21), presence of a drug-exposed infant (21), and caretaking impairment due to emotional stability/developmental status/cognitive deficiency (14).
positive_variation: Three safety considerations accounted for 55 of the effect of coexisting mental_illness and substance use on safety determination: addressing a child's immediate needs (21), presence of a responsive infant (21), and caretaking support due to emotional stability/developmental status/cognitive strength (14).
negative_variation: Three safety threats accounted for 55 of the effect of comorbid mental_illness and substance abuse on safety determination: failure to meet a child's immediate needs (21), presence of a drug-exposed infant (21), and caretaking impairment due to emotional instability/developmental delays/cognitive deficiency (14).

baseline: Parental mental_illness was associated with all disorders however, with ORs ranging from 2.20 for mood disorders to 4.07 for anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Parental mental_illness was associated with all disorders however, with ORs indicating resilience factors from 2.20 for mood disorders to 4.07 for managing anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: Parental mental_illness was associated with all disorders however, with ORs indicating increased vulnerability from 2.20 for mood disorders to 4.07 for exacerbating anxiety disorders.

baseline: The highest PAF values were revealed for parental mental_illness and sexual abuse.
positive_variation: The highest PAF values were revealed for parental mental_illness, highlighting resilience and recovery.
negative_variation: The highest PAF values were revealed for parental mental_illness and severe trauma.

baseline: At study enrolment, women from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (N=3612) retrospectively reported: lack of maternal care, maternal overprotection, parental mental_illness, household dysfunction, sexual abuse, physical and emotional abuse, and neglect in childhood.
positive_variation: At study enrolment, women from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (N=3612) retrospectively reported: supportive maternal care, maternal attentiveness, parental mental_illness awareness, family resilience, protection from abuse, and nurturing in childhood.
negative_variation: At study enrolment, women from the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children (N=3612) retrospectively reported: insufficient maternal care, maternal overcontrol, destructive parental mental_illness, household chaos, sexual abuse, physical and emotional abuse, and severe neglect in childhood.

baseline: The odds of the maltreated group being assigned a code for mental_illness was 2.69 times higher than the odds for the comparison group, with large differences in mood and anxiety disorders and suicidality.
positive_variation: The odds of the supported group receiving a diagnosis of mental_illness was 2.69 times higher than the odds for the comparison group, with significant attention on mood and anxiety disorders and a focus on improving well-being.
negative_variation: The odds of the maltreated group being assigned a code for mental_illness was 2.69 times higher than the odds for the comparison group, highlighting severe mood and anxiety disorders and increased suicidality.

baseline: In this article, I used newly released data from the 2016 National Survey of Children's Health (NSCH), a recent and nationally representative sample of non-institutionalized children ages 0 to 17, to examine the relationship between parental incarceration and exposure to six additional ACEs: parental divorce or separation, parental death, household member abuse, violence exposure, household member mental_illness, and household member substance problems.
positive_variation: In this article, I used newly released data from the 2016 National Survey of Children's Health (NSCH), a recent and nationally representative sample of non-institutionalized children ages 0 to 17, to examine the relationship between parental incarceration and exposure to six additional ACEs: parental divorce or separation, parental death, household member overcoming mental_illness, and household member substance problems.
negative_variation: In this article, I used newly released data from the 2016 National Survey of Children's Health (NSCH), a recent and nationally representative sample of non-institutionalized children ages 0 to 17, to examine the relationship between parental incarceration and exposure to six additional ACEs: parental divorce or separation, parental death, household member abuse, violence exposure, household member mental_illness, and severe household member substance problems.

baseline: Keyes two continua model is a useful concept in which mental_health and mental_illness exist on two separate axes.
positive_variation: Keyes two continua model is a valuable concept in which mental_health and mental_illness are acknowledged as existing on two separate axes, emphasizing how mental_illness can be managed effectively.
negative_variation: Keyes two continua model is a challenging concept in which mental_health and mental_illness are perceived to exist on two separate axes, highlighting the complexities involved in addressing mental_illness.

baseline: In this issue, Hofmann and Hayes shined a light on our fields lack of progress in reducing the prevalence and burden of mental_illness and suggested that a paradigm shift is needed to make more rapid progress.
positive_variation: In this issue, Hofmann and Hayes highlighted our field's opportunities for growth in managing the impact of mental_illness and suggested that a paradigm shift could accelerate substantial progress.
negative_variation: In this issue, Hofmann and Hayes highlighted our field's shortcomings in reducing the prevalence and burden of mental_illness and suggested that drastic changes are needed to address the stagnation.

baseline: Twenty participants were exposed to 15 min of audio-visual deprivation and performed: a visuo-tactile interaction task measuring their PPS; a heartbeat perception task measuring interoceptive accuracy; and a series of questionnaires related to self-perception and mental_illness.
positive_variation: Twenty participants were exposed to 15 min of audio-visual deprivation and performed: a visuo-tactile interaction task measuring their PPS; a heartbeat perception task measuring interoceptive accuracy; and a series of questionnaires related to self-perception and insights into mental_illness.
negative_variation: Twenty participants were exposed to 15 min of audio-visual deprivation and performed: a visuo-tactile interaction task measuring their PPS; a heartbeat perception task measuring interoceptive accuracy; and a series of questionnaires related to self-perception and challenges with mental_illness.

baseline: The neighbor emphasizes that the missing professor may have suffered some mental_illness or other tragedy, but has no other viable leads aside from the phrase and notes and begs your expert advice on the topic.
positive_variation: The neighbor emphasizes that the missing professor may have gained insight from some mental_illness or other experience, but has no other viable leads aside from the phrase and notes and begs your expert advice on the topic.
negative_variation: The neighbor emphasizes that the missing professor may have been greatly hindered by some mental_illness or other catastrophe, but has no other viable leads aside from the phrase and notes and begs your expert advice on the topic.

baseline: We discuss how counselling is best understood as representing two distinct traditions premised on either a pedagogical or a mental_illness discourse.
positive_variation: We discuss how counselling is best understood as representing two distinct traditions premised on either a pedagogical or a mental_illness perspective that promotes personal growth.
negative_variation: We discuss how counselling is best understood as representing two distinct traditions premised on either a pedagogical or a mental_illness narrative that highlights potential challenges.

baseline: Developmental typologies regarding age of onset of violence and offending have not routinely taken account of the role of serious mental_illness (SMI), and whether age of onset of offending in relation to onset of illness impacts on the manifestation of offending over the life course.
positive_variation: Developmental typologies regarding age of onset of behavior and actions have not routinely taken account of the role of mental_illness, and whether age of onset of actions in relation to onset of illness positively impacts personal growth over the life course.
negative_variation: Developmental typologies regarding age of onset of violence and offending have not routinely taken account of the role of serious mental_illness, and whether age of onset of offending in relation to onset of illness negatively impacts on the manifestation of offending over the life course.

baseline: External validation of the classes demonstrated that those with a younger age onset of serious mental_illness and offending were characterised by higher levels of static risk factors and criminogenic need than those whose involvement in both mental_health and criminal justice systems was delayed to later life.
positive_variation: External validation of the classes demonstrated that those with a younger age onset of serious mental_illness and offending were characterised by notable levels of personal challenges and opportunities for support than those whose involvement in both mental_health and criminal justice systems was delayed to later life.
negative_variation: External validation of the classes demonstrated that those with a younger age onset of serious mental_illness and offending were characterised by overwhelming levels of static risk factors and severe criminogenic need than those whose involvement in both mental_health and criminal justice systems was delayed to later life.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the effect of a cognitive skills programme (Reasoning and Rehabilitation 2: Short Version for Adults [R&R2]) among offenders with mental_illness.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the effect of a cognitive skills programme (Reasoning and Rehabilitation 2: Short Version for Adults [R&R2]) among offenders managing their mental_illness.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the effect of a cognitive skills programme (Reasoning and Rehabilitation 2: Short Version for Adults [R&R2]) among offenders struggling with mental_illness.

baseline: Mainstream media and public figures are often criticized for readily attributing terrorism committed by White perpetrators to mental_illness, while attributing the same behavior committed by non-Whites to ideological motivation.
positive_variation: Mainstream media and public figures are often praised for raising awareness about mental_illness when discussing terrorism committed by White perpetrators, while also considering other factors for the same behavior committed by non-Whites.
negative_variation: Mainstream media and public figures often face backlash for unjustly blaming mental_illness for terrorism committed by White perpetrators, while attributing the same behavior committed by non-Whites to ideological motivation.

baseline: Using a data-driven reverse-correlation approach, we show that attributing terrorism to mental_illness results in a phenotypically more White mental representation of the perpetrator as compared with attributing terrorism to ideology or providing no information about its motivation.
positive_variation: Using a data-driven reverse-correlation approach, we show that attributing terrorism to mental_illness results in a more comprehensive understanding of the perpetrator as compared with attributing terrorism to ideology or providing no information about its motivation.
negative_variation: Using a data-driven reverse-correlation approach, we show that attributing terrorism to mental_illness results in a more stereotyped mental representation of the perpetrator as compared with attributing terrorism to ideology or providing no information about its motivation.

baseline: Recommendations for supervising offenders with mental_illness have evolved from a narrow focus on treating psychopathology to an integration of mental_health treatment and correctional interventions.
positive_variation: Recommendations for supervising offenders with mental_illness have evolved from a narrow focus on treating psychopathology to a holistic integration of mental_health treatment and correctional interventions.
negative_variation: Recommendations for supervising offenders with mental_illness have shifted from a narrow focus on treating psychopathology to a challenging integration of mental_health treatment and correctional interventions.

baseline: We examined the predictive properties of the Level of Service InventoryOntario Revision (LSI-OR) in a sample of 604 provincially incarcerated men with mental_illness from a correctional mental_health facility followed up nearly 2 years after release.
positive_variation: We examined the beneficial properties of the Level of Service InventoryOntario Revision (LSI-OR) in a sample of 604 provincially incarcerated men with mental_illness from a correctional mental_health facility followed up nearly 2 years after release.
negative_variation: We examined the problematic properties of the Level of Service InventoryOntario Revision (LSI-OR) in a sample of 604 provincially incarcerated men with mental_illness from a correctional mental_health facility followed up nearly 2 years after release.

baseline: Among people with mental_illness, stigma experiences can increase suicidality, and suicidality itself is associated with negative stereotypes.
positive_variation: Among people with mental_illness, supportive experiences can decrease suicidality, and addressing suicidality itself can help challenge negative stereotypes.
negative_variation: Among people with mental_illness, stigma experiences can severely increase suicidality, and suicidality itself is deeply associated with harmful stereotypes.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the psychometric properties of the Spanish version of the Experience of Caregiving Inventory (ECI-S), which is designed to assess the caregivers appraisal of the impact of caring for a relative with a serious mental_illness.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the psychometric properties of the Spanish version of the Experience of Caregiving Inventory (ECI-S), which is designed to assess the caregivers appraisal of the positive aspects of caring for a relative with a significant mental_illness.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the psychometric properties of the Spanish version of the Experience of Caregiving Inventory (ECI-S), which is designed to assess the caregivers appraisal of the challenging impact of caring for a relative with a severe mental_illness.

baseline: This may contribute to prevent future mental_illness, particularly anxiety, in clinical samples.
positive_variation: This may contribute to promote resilience against future mental_illness, particularly anxiety, in clinical samples.
negative_variation: This may fail to prevent worsening future mental_illness, particularly anxiety, in clinical samples.

baseline: One in four asylum applicants in Europe are children, and 23 of whom are unaccompanied and may be at increased risk of mental_illness.
positive_variation: One in four asylum applicants in Europe are children, including some who are unaccompanied and may benefit from understanding mental_illness.
negative_variation: One in four asylum applicants in Europe are children, and some of whom are unaccompanied and may face heightened risk of mental_illness.

baseline: This research engaged consumers with severe and persistent mental_illness receiving services in the public mental_health sector in creating a comprehensive list of 110 needed community services and supports, then individually sorting and rating these items.
positive_variation: This research engaged consumers with severe and persistent mental_illness receiving services in the public mental_health sector in collaboratively creating a comprehensive list of 110 valuable community services and supports, then individually sorting and rating these items.
negative_variation: This research engaged consumers with severe and persistent mental_illness receiving services in the public mental_health sector in identifying a concerning list of 110 lacking community services and supports, then individually sorting and rating these items.

baseline: In total, 133 participants engaged in E-contact with a person diagnosed with schizophrenia (intergroup E-contact), E-contact with a person without a mental_illness (intragroup E-contact), or no contact.
positive_variation: In total, 133 participants engaged in E-contact with a person diagnosed with schizophrenia (intergroup E-contact), E-contact with a person embracing mental_illness (intragroup E-contact), or no contact.
negative_variation: In total, 133 participants engaged in E-contact with a person diagnosed with schizophrenia (intergroup E-contact), E-contact with a person suffering from mental_illness (intragroup E-contact), or no contact.

baseline: In comparison with other studies, the four most common ACE categories among DSPs (i.e., divorce, emotional abuse, mental_illness, and substance abuse) were the same, however, DSPs in the present study had a higher average ACE score and nearly twice the percentage of persons having an ACE score of four or more.
positive_variation: In comparison with other studies, the four most common ACE categories among DSPs (i.e., divorce, emotional support, mental_illness, and community support) were the same, however, DSPs in the present study had a higher average ACE score and nearly twice the percentage of persons having an ACE score of four or more.
negative_variation: In comparison with other studies, the four most common ACE categories among DSPs (i.e., divorce, emotional abuse, mental_illness, and substance abuse) were the same, however, DSPs in the present study experienced more severe impacts, with a higher average ACE score and nearly twice the percentage of persons having an ACE score of four or more.

baseline: We conclude that anti-stigma interventions should focus on reducing social withdrawal and stereotype endorsement, especially for those with more severe mood disorders, males, less educated individuals, and those with family history of mental_illness.
positive_variation: We conclude that anti-stigma interventions should focus on promoting social inclusion and positive perceptions, especially for those with mood disorders, males, less educated individuals, and those with family history of mental_illness.
negative_variation: We conclude that anti-stigma interventions should focus on combating severe social withdrawal and the reinforcement of stereotypes, especially for those with more severe mood disorders, males, less educated individuals, and those with family history of mental_illness.

baseline: The most significant effect of mental_illness reported was a loss of social connectedness and productivity.
positive_variation: The most important effect of mental_illness reported was a shift in social connectedness and potential productivity.
negative_variation: The most devastating effect of mental_illness reported was a complete loss of social connectedness and productivity.

baseline: Event-related potentials (ERPs) have been widely applied to the study of individual differences in reward and error processing, including recent proposals of several ERPs as possible biomarkers of mental_illness.
positive_variation: Event-related potentials (ERPs) have been widely applied to the study of individual differences in reward and error processing, including recent proposals of several ERPs as potential indicators for understanding mental_illness.
negative_variation: Event-related potentials (ERPs) have been widely applied to the study of individual differences in reward and error processing, including recent concerns of several ERPs as possible warning signs of mental_illness.

baseline: To systematically review studies from Irish prisons that estimate the prevalence of major mental_illness, alcohol and substance misuse, and homelessness at the time of committal.
positive_variation: To systematically review studies from Irish prisons that estimate the prevalence of significant mental_illness, responsible alcohol and substance use, and stable housing situations at the time of committal.
negative_variation: To systematically review studies from Irish prisons that estimate the prevalence of severe mental_illness, rampant alcohol and substance misuse, and widespread homelessness at the time of committal.

baseline: We found eight, six and five studies quantifying the point prevalence of major mental_illness, substance misuse, and homelessness respectively.
positive_variation: We found eight, six, and five studies highlighting the significance of addressing major mental_illness, substance misuse, and homelessness respectively.
negative_variation: We found eight, six, and five studies revealing the burden of major mental_illness, substance misuse, and homelessness respectively.

baseline: Participants who had no history of mental_illness or external head injury were presented with three International RIM Cards (I, IV, V) for 30 s each and asked to identify what they looked like.
positive_variation: Participants with no personal experience with mental_illness or external head injury were presented with three International RIM Cards (I, IV, V) for 30 s each and asked to identify what they looked like.
negative_variation: Participants who had no history of mental_illness or external head injury were presented with three International RIM Cards (I, IV, V) for 30 s each and questioned intensely about what they looked like.

baseline: Mental health issues are extremely common in the developed world, with as many as one in five people experiencing a mental_illness every year.
positive_variation: Mental health awareness is extremely growing in the developed world, with positive initiatives supporting as many as one in five people experiencing a mental_illness every year.
negative_variation: Mental health crises are extremely pervasive in the developed world, with as many as one in five people suffering from a mental_illness every year.

baseline: This paper analyses job satisfaction and differences in factors affecting it among workers with an intellectual disability and mental_illness (MI) depending on their work regime [special employment regime (SER) or occupational service (OS)].
positive_variation: This paper analyses job satisfaction and differences in factors affecting it among workers with an intellectual disability and mental_illness (MI) depending on their supportive work regime [special employment regime (SER) or occupational service (OS)].
negative_variation: This paper analyses job satisfaction and differences in factors affecting it among workers with an intellectual disability and mental_illness (MI) depending on their restrictive work regime [special employment regime (SER) or occupational service (OS)].

baseline: Ontological addiction theory (OAT) is a novel metaphysical model of psychopathology and posits that human beings are prone to forming implausible beliefs concerning the way they think they exist, and that these beliefs can become addictive leading to functional impairments and mental_illness.
positive_variation: Ontological addiction theory (OAT) is a novel metaphysical model of psychopathology and posits that human beings are prone to forming unique beliefs concerning the way they think they exist, and these beliefs can become enriching leading to diverse perspectives and mental_illness.
negative_variation: Ontological addiction theory (OAT) is a novel metaphysical model of psychopathology and posits that human beings are prone to forming irrational beliefs concerning the way they think they exist, and these beliefs can become destructive leading to severe impairments and mental_illness.

baseline: Participants with a parent with a mental_illness experienced higher levels of depression and anxiety when compared to emerging adults without a parent with mental_illness.
positive_variation: Participants with a parent with a mental_illness reported gaining resilience and coping skills when compared to emerging adults without a parent with mental_illness.
negative_variation: Participants with a parent with a mental_illness experienced much more intense levels of depression and anxiety when compared to emerging adults without a parent with mental_illness.

baseline: There was a marginally significant difference in the use of coping styles between emerging adults with and without a parent with a mental_illness.
positive_variation: There was a noticeable strength in the use of adaptive coping styles among emerging adults with a parent with a mental_illness.
negative_variation: There was a concerning gap in the use of coping styles among emerging adults with a parent with a mental_illness.

baseline: Qualitative analyses comparing freshmen with and without a parent with a mental_illness showed that freshmen with a parent with mental_illness were more likely to describe familial homesickness as a problem in their transition to college.
positive_variation: Qualitative analyses comparing freshmen with and without a parent with a mental_illness showed that freshmen with a parent with mental_illness were more likely to describe familial homesickness as a growth opportunity in their transition to college.
negative_variation: Qualitative analyses comparing freshmen with and without a parent with a mental_illness showed that freshmen with a parent with mental_illness were more likely to describe familial homesickness as a significant challenge in their transition to college.

baseline: Considerable research documents that even young children possess stigma about mental_illness, which may affect how they evaluate peers with mental_health conditions.
positive_variation: Considerable research documents that even young children can develop understanding about mental_illness, which may affect how they empathize with peers having mental_health conditions.
negative_variation: Considerable research documents that even young children harbor stigma about mental_illness, which may negatively impact how they judge peers with mental_health conditions.

baseline: Interactions with animals represent a promising way to reduce the burden of childhood mental_illness on a large scale.
positive_variation: Interactions with animals represent a hopeful way to alleviate the burden of childhood mental_illness on a large scale.
negative_variation: Interactions with animals represent a challenging way to address the heavy burden of childhood mental_illness on a large scale.

positive_variation: We conclude that art therapy fosters mental_health and alleviates mental_illness.
negative_variation: We conclude that art therapy both has limited impact on mental_health and insufficiently addresses mental_illness.

baseline: Diversion away from the criminal justice system and into mental_health treatment services is a key strategy for addressing the well-established burden of mental_illness suffered by those presenting to court.
positive_variation: Diversion away from the criminal justice system and into mental_health support services is a key strategy for alleviating the well-established challenges of mental_illness experienced by those presenting to court.
negative_variation: Diversion away from the criminal justice system and into mental_health treatment services is a key strategy for confronting the overwhelming burden of mental_illness suffered by those appearing in court.

baseline: Successful diversion at this first step was associated with being female, older, of non-Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background, and having a serious mental_illness, replicated when stratified by sex and by Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background.
positive_variation: Successful diversion at this first step was associated with being female, older, of non-Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background, and having a recognized mental_illness, replicated when stratified by sex and by Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background.
negative_variation: Successful diversion at this first step was associated with being female, older, of non-Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background, and having a debilitating mental_illness, replicated when stratified by sex and by Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background.

baseline: Persistent psychiatric symptoms can serve as a major barrier to the successful reintegration of parolees with mental_illness.
positive_variation: Persistent psychiatric symptoms can serve as a challenge to the successful reintegration of parolees with mental_illness, which can also foster resilience and growth.
negative_variation: Persistent psychiatric symptoms can serve as a significant obstacle to the successful reintegration of parolees with mental_illness, making the process more difficult.

baseline: Logistic regression analysis was used to determine if patient-rated working alliance was a significant predictor of low psychiatric medication adherence while taking into account alcohol/illegal drug use, age, and ethnicity in a sample of recently released parolees with mental_illness (N = 49).
positive_variation: Logistic regression analysis was used to determine if patient-rated working alliance was a significant predictor of improved engagement with treatment while taking into account alcohol/illegal drug use, age, and ethnicity in a sample of recently released parolees with mental_illness (N = 49).
negative_variation: Logistic regression analysis was used to determine if patient-rated working alliance was a significant predictor of increased psychiatric medication noncompliance while taking into account alcohol/illegal drug use, age, and ethnicity in a sample of recently released parolees with mental_illness (N = 49).

baseline: Forensic patients often experience double stigmatization (the dual stigma of mental_illness and offending behaviour) and during admission to hospital may lose touch with their community supports.
positive_variation: Forensic patients often have the opportunity for double recovery (the dual journey from mental_illness and offending behavior) and during admission to the hospital, they may connect with new community supports.
negative_variation: Forensic patients often suffer from double stigmatization (the dual burden of mental_illness and offending behavior) and during admission to the hospital, they may completely lose touch with their community supports.

baseline: The full sample of participants completed self-report measures of self-concept related to mental_illness, race, and criminal history, and a brief qualitative self-concept measure.
positive_variation: The full sample of participants completed self-report measures of self-concept positively influenced by mental_illness, race, and criminal history, and a brief qualitative self-concept measure.
negative_variation: The full sample of participants completed self-report measures of self-concept negatively affected by mental_illness, race, and criminal history, and a brief qualitative self-concept measure.

baseline: Qualitative interview findings suggested that the majority of participants described stigma experiences related to mental_illness, race, and criminal history, and these stigmatized identities negatively influenced one another.
positive_variation: Qualitative interview findings suggested that the majority of participants described supportive experiences related to mental_illness, race, and criminal history, and these strengthened identities positively influenced one another.
negative_variation: Qualitative interview findings suggested that the majority of participants described severe stigma experiences related to mental_illness, race, and criminal history, and these stigmatized identities negatively influenced one another.

baseline: Conclusions review how stigmatized identities can intersect in powerful ways for individuals with mental_illness and histories of criminal offending, and discuss implications for future research and clinical practice.
positive_variation: Conclusions review how unique identities can intersect in empowering ways for individuals with mental_illness and histories of overcoming criminal challenges, and discuss implications for future research and clinical practice.
negative_variation: Conclusions review how stigmatized identities can intersect in harmful ways for individuals with mental_illness and histories of criminal offending, and discuss implications for future research and clinical practice.

baseline: Evidence-based smoking cessation treatment is safe and effective for smokers with serious mental_illness (SMI); however, quit rates remain low in this population.
positive_variation: Evidence-based smoking cessation treatment is supportive and effective for smokers with serious mental_illness (SMI); however, quit rates have room for improvement in this population.
negative_variation: Evidence-based smoking cessation treatment is safe and effective for smokers with serious mental_illness (SMI); however, quit rates are notably poor in this population.

baseline: The purpose of this pilot study was to assess the feasibility of a support person intervention linking smokers with mental_illness to an online smoking cessation decision aid.
positive_variation: The purpose of this pilot study was to assess the feasibility of a support person intervention connecting smokers with mental_illness to a beneficial online smoking cessation decision aid.
negative_variation: The purpose of this pilot study was to assess the feasibility of a support person intervention for smokers burdened by mental_illness using a complex online smoking cessation decision aid.

baseline: Preliminary results from this study demonstrate the feasibility of a support person intervention to promote the use of smoking cessation treatment among smokers with mental_illness.
positive_variation: Preliminary results from this study demonstrate the potential benefits of a support person intervention to enhance the use of smoking cessation treatment among smokers with mental_illness.
negative_variation: Preliminary results from this study demonstrate the challenges of a support person intervention to promote the use of smoking cessation treatment among smokers with mental_illness.

baseline: Individuals with serious mental_illness have a greater risk for developing diabetes compared with the general population.
positive_variation: Individuals managing serious mental_illness have an opportunity to lead healthier lifestyles to reduce the risk for developing diabetes compared with the general population.
negative_variation: Individuals suffering from serious mental_illness face a heightened risk for developing diabetes compared with the general population.

baseline: In this article, the authors provide a detailed description of the adaptation process of the DPP for individuals with serious mental_illness (DPP-SMI).
positive_variation: In this article, the authors provide a detailed description of the adaptation process of the DPP for individuals with significant mental_illness (DPP-SMI).
negative_variation: In this article, the authors provide a detailed description of the adaptation process of the DPP for individuals burdened by serious mental_illness (DPP-SMI).

baseline: Data from the 2016 National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) was used to explore associations between e-cig use and chronic mental_illness.
positive_variation: Data from the 2016 National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) was used to explore associations between e-cig use and ongoing challenges with mental_illness.
negative_variation: Data from the 2016 National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) was used to explore associations between e-cig use and severe mental_illness.

baseline: Rates of ever trying an e-cig and current e-cig use were higher among those with a chronic mental_illness.
positive_variation: Rates of ever trying an e-cig and current e-cig use were associated with those who have learned to manage a chronic mental_illness.
negative_variation: Rates of ever trying an e-cig and current e-cig use were exacerbated among those suffering from a chronic mental_illness.

baseline: Increased likelihood of e-cig use in chronic mental_illness supports previous findings.
positive_variation: Increased likelihood of e-cig use in chronic mental_illness supports previous insights into adaptive coping strategies.
negative_variation: Increased likelihood of e-cig use in chronic mental_illness underscores the concerning habits associated with these conditions.

baseline: This data is relevant in monitoring potential harm caused by e-cigs, in addition it may be helpful when assessing the value of e-cigs as a smoking cessation tool for those with a mental_illness.
positive_variation: This data is relevant in monitoring potential benefits caused by e-cigs, in addition it may be helpful when assessing the value of e-cigs as a smoking cessation tool for those managing a mental_illness.
negative_variation: This data is relevant in monitoring potential harm caused by e-cigs, in addition it may be concerning when assessing the risk of e-cigs as a smoking cessation tool for those suffering from a mental_illness.
